recipe.name: Middle Eastern Shredded Lamb
recipe.description: I can't say with certainty that this is authentic because it's a recipe I created. But it uses classic Middle Eastern ingredients, so possibly it is! The lamb is really juicy because it's made with lamb shoulder, a cut that is made for slow cooking. The pan frying step to get the crunchy brown bits is not optional - it's key! ! ! As with any shredded meat recipe, a little goes a long way. This makes around 8 cups of shredded lamb which I think is enough to serve 8 people as a main (with rice). See separate recipe below for Chickpea Pilaf (Rice).
recipeIngredient: 2 tsp ground cardamon (or sub with ginger)
1.5 - 2 kg / 3 - 4 lb  lamb shoulder (bone in, trimmed of excess fat)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the Spice Mix ingredients in a small bowl. Set aside 1 1/2 tbsp of the Spice Mix for later (to pan fry the lamb).
recipeInstructions.name: Combine the Spice Mix ingredients in a small bowl. Set aside 1 1/2 tbsp of the Spice Mix for later (to pan fry the lamb).

recipeInstructions.text: Add the olive oil and garlic into the Spice Mix, then rub all over the lamb.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the olive oil and garlic into the Spice Mix, then rub all over the lamb.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the lamb on a roasting rack set in a roasting dish (Note 1). Pour the water in the base of the dish. Cover with a lid or double layer of foil.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the lamb on a roasting rack set in a roasting dish (Note 1). Pour the water in the base of the dish. Cover with a lid or double layer of foil.

recipeInstructions.text: Roast for 3 1/2 hours or until the meat is tender enough to pull off with a fork.
recipeInstructions.name: Roast for 3 1/2 hours or until the meat is tender enough to pull off with a fork.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the lid. Turn the oven up as high as it will go and roast for 15 - 20 minutes until the lamb is browned.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the lid. Turn the oven up as high as it will go and roast for 15 - 20 minutes until the lamb is browned.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the lamb from the oven. Allow to rest for 20 minutes, then shred coarsely with two forks.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove the lamb from the oven. Allow to rest for 20 minutes, then shred coarsely with two forks.

recipeInstructions.text: Skim excess fat off the juices in the roasting dish then set aside. (Note 2)
recipeInstructions.name: Skim excess fat off the juices in the roasting dish then set aside. (Note 2)

itemListElement.text: Toss the shredded lamb with the reserved Spice Mix (from Step 2 above).
itemListElement.name: Toss the shredded lamb with the reserved Spice Mix (from Step 2 above).

itemListElement.text: Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a heavy based pan over high heat. Add some lamb (don't crowd the pan) and drizzle over about 3 tbsp of the pan juices. Cook until the underside is dark golden brown and crispy - about 1 to 1 1/2 minutes (the juices you poured over will evaporate).
itemListElement.name: Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a heavy based pan over high heat. Add some lamb (don't crowd the pan) and drizzle over about 3 tbsp of the pan juices. Cook until the underside is dark golden brown and crispy - about 1 to 1 1/2 minutes (the juices you poured over will evaporate).

itemListElement.text: If the lamb is cold, flip to warm the other side but do not brown too much (retains juiciness).
itemListElement.name: If the lamb is cold, flip to warm the other side but do not brown too much (retains juiciness).

itemListElement.text: Remove lamb from the fry pan, and repeat with remaining lamb, adding extra oil if required.
itemListElement.name: Remove lamb from the fry pan, and repeat with remaining lamb, adding extra oil if required.

itemListElement.text: To serve, drizzle with a squeeze of lemon juice (this makes a big difference) and top with fresh coriander, plus yoghurt (if using). Serve on Chickpea Pilaf (Rice).
itemListElement.name: To serve, drizzle with a squeeze of lemon juice (this makes a big difference) and top with fresh coriander, plus yoghurt (if using). Serve on Chickpea Pilaf (Rice).

review.reviewBody: Absolutely delicious! Wonderful depth of flavors-the only thing my family requested was maybe a little tzatziki to add a saucy/cool element. But a definite keeper! Side note-everything Iâ€™ve made from this site is great! Thank you! :)
OMG!!!! This was wonderful. YUM, YUM, YUM!!!!!!!

My family loved this!  Frying the lamb with the juice is what makes this dish (as Nagi says!!!).  I altered slightly the pilaf to fit with what we had, but the lamb was gorgeous!  As she says the final browning is NOT optional!
Hi there my name is Bella ilove middle east food im from south africa south

This was excellent! Lamb shoulder is one of my favorite cuts, we raise our own lamb and Iâ€™m always looking for new and easy recipes. Loved both the rice and the lamb. I didnâ€™t sear it for the first night but did for leftover night and the crunchy bits were soooo good. I paired this with homemade tabbouli and pita, and store bought hummus. Fresh lemon wedges were a must! This will go into my rotation, for sure.

This recipe should pop up when someone googled Best Lamb Recipe In The History Of Ever. Iâ€™m not a fan on lamb because itâ€™s normally so badly cooked, but this has changed my views towards it. Thank you - the entire family loves it!!!
I've made this several times and it is a winner. We are big Middle Eastern food and and this hits all the right notes. We love it with Nagi's Fragrant Chickpea Rice Pilaf and green beans.
